description: shadcn-dev hooks - cache refresh and learnings capture

hooks.message:
Check if the shadcn-dev cache needs refreshing:

1. Read `${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/.cache/learnings.md` if it exists
2. Check the `last_refresh` date in the YAML frontmatter
3. If the file doesn't exist OR `last_refresh` is more than 7 days ago:
   - Inform the user: "shadcn/Tailwind documentation cache is stale. Would you like me to refresh it?"
   - If they agree, use WebFetch to get latest docs from:
     - https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/installation (installation guide)
     - https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/cli (CLI reference)
     - https://tailwindcss.com/docs/installation (Tailwind v4 installation)
   - Update the cache file with fresh content, preserving the Learnings section
   - Update `last_refresh` to today's date
4. If cache is fresh (less than 7 days old), continue silently

This check ensures documentation stays current without overwhelming users with frequent refreshes.

If this session involved shadcn/ui or Tailwind CSS work (component installation, theming, forms, tables, configuration):

1. Read `${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}/.cache/learnings.md` if it exists
2. Check if `settings.capture_learnings` is true (default: true)
3. If learnings capture is enabled AND shadcn/Tailwind work was done:
   - Briefly ask: "Would you like to capture any learnings from this session? (patterns that worked well, mistakes to avoid)"
   - If user shares learnings, append to the appropriate section with today's date:
     - Successful Patterns: Things that worked well
     - Mistakes to Avoid: Issues encountered and solutions
4. If no shadcn/Tailwind work was done, skip this check silently

Keep the prompt brief and non-intrusive. Only ask when relevant work was actually done.
